creator: fred@stsci.edu
text:
If Tomcat is restarted, but the apache server is not, I seem to be getting
intermittant errors about the web-application not being deployed yet.  This
behavior shows up with the examples that come with Tomcat 4 with the latest
CVS version.  It would be nice if the connector recovered from the tomcat
restart, but is not necessary.

Correct. Dynamic reconfiguration is on the TODO list toghether with
context-sharing between Apache and Tomcat. It should go through
next week if I can get a hold on it and finish the patches (this is a major
change in the WARP protocol).
For now, the best thing to do is to issue an "apachectl restart" after you
have restarted Tomcat, so that configurations are correctly passed
back and forth between the two.
creator: pier@betaversion.org
pier@betaversion.org
text:
When Tomcat is restarted, now the WebApp module automatically reconnects thru WARP.

Previously the first request sent to Apache will come up with an error saying "Communitcation interrupted", but depending on the number of active processes, that might have taken quite a while (every process had to reconnect).

Now if the first packet doesn't go thru, we try once to re-establish connection with Tomcat, so the "Communication interrupted" message doesn't pop up anymore.
